title: Southern Fried Chicken
tagline: Buttermilk-brined, shatteringly crispy. Worth every step.
description: Buttermilk-brined, extra crispy coating. Worth the effort. Serves 4.
ingredients: Buttermilk Brine: 3-4 lbs chicken pieces (thighs, drumsticks, breasts), 2 cups buttermilk, 2 tbsp kosher salt, 1 tbsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp cayenne
Dredge: 2 cups all-purpose flour, ½ cup cornstarch, 1 tbsp paprika, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper
For Frying: Vegetable oil or peanut oil (enough for 1" depth in pan)
steps: Brine: Whisk buttermilk, salt, paprika, garlic powder, and cayenne. Submerge chicken pieces. Refrigerate at least 6 hours, preferably overnight.
Mix dredge: Combine flour, cornstarch, paprika, garlic powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper in a wide bowl.
Double dredge: Remove chicken from buttermilk (don't shake off excess). Coat in flour mixture. Dip back in buttermilk. Coat in flour again. Let sit on rack 10 minutes.
Heat oil to 350°F in Dutch oven or deep skillet. Use a thermometer.
Fry in batches (don't crowd): Dark meat 13-15 minutes, breasts 15-18 minutes. Flip halfway. Internal temp should reach 165°F.
Drain on wire rack (not paper towels—they make it soggy). Season with pinch of salt immediately.
notes: Cornstarch = extra crispy: It creates a shatteringly crunchy coating. Don't skip it.
Double dredge: The second coating is what gives you that craggy, crispy exterior.
Don't crowd: Too much chicken drops oil temp = greasy, soggy coating.
Wire rack: Draining on paper towels traps steam and makes bottom soggy.
Storage: Best fresh. Reheat in 400°F oven on wire rack to re-crisp.
source: Adapted from Serious Eats Food Lab
